name: Agricultural Simulator: Historical Farming
description: Enjoy being a farmer between 1950 and 1970 in the Agricultural Simulator – Historical Farming. The game takes you to the good old days and you will experience the charming farming of the 60's and 70's. Fans of nostalgia and history will be glad to work with original designed machines and to till a field with well known Old-timer Tractors.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP / 7 / Vista / 8 Processor: 2,4 GHz Pentium or 100% compatible CPU Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia Geforce 6800GT, ATI Radeon HD 3650 Storage: 1300 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP / 7 / Vista / 8 Processor: 3,0 GHz Pentium or 100% compatible CPU Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GTX 560, ATI Radeon HD 6970 Storage: 1300 MB available space

reviews.review_text: AgriBUGutral Simulator Historical Crashing  The gamemodes are as follows -See how long you can go before crashing

I tried to get into my tractor for about 10 minutes, then it occured to me that the very idea of living had suddenly lost all meaning and i frantically started pressing all buttons. Somehow i got into my tractor and instantly got stuck in a pig. Deleted.   9/10 potatoes, would feed to dog.

Pros: - You can chase chickens with your tractor. - You can do back flips on your tractor and you can't fall (requires practice and an incline). - There appears to be a deserted church, could be the start of a horror game disguised as a farming sim?  Cons: - Costs money.
Busted and buggy. The game is fun but it is lacking a lot of details and polish. Feels pretty empty.
I find myself asking the question;  'Why do I even own this game?'
All the problems of Agricultural Simulator 2013 with fewer features (fewer machines, less map). Don't waste money on this.
The game keeps jamming my al the time.  Do somewan now how too stop that Jamming?  I play this on windows 10 is that the problem?  let my pleas now it i find it a funny game but its keeping jamming.
So my friend got me this game. I highly don't reccomend it because it just sucks. The background... Sucks...

Agricultural Simulator: Historical Farming, takes the Agricultural Simulator series of games on a time-traveling trip back to mid 20th century world of Farming. Using vintage equipment, you can create your own workable farm. Agricultural Simulator: Historical Farming also allows you to Co-Op play with a friend, so you can work a farm together. The game basically plays the same way as Agricultural Simulator 2013, but without the newer equipment, which makes it more of a challenge. This particular game does not appear to have a playable tutorial the way Agricultural Simulator 2013 did, but there are places online where you can download a free demo, so I would recommend doing that before purchasing the game so you know exactly what you are getting into before you spend money.  I think as a simulator, this game is no different then other Agricultural Simulators and would probably have been a better DLC to Agri Sim 2013, as opposed to a standalone. In any case, it's not a bad game and should present a decent challenge to fan's of the Agricultural Simulator games.

Enjoy being a farmer between 1950 and 1970 in the Agricultural Simulator – Historical Farming. The game takes you to the good old days and you will experience the charming farming of the 60's and 70's. Fans of nostalgia and history will be glad to work with original designed machines and to till a field with well known Old-timer Tractors. With the new feature – the dynamic ground Agrar Simulator – Historical Farming presents the first real furrows which will be left when working at the fields with strong machines. The furrows will have impact on the driving behavior of the tractors and guarantee pure realism. It is up to the player to decide in which region he would like to cultivate his farm. There are two amazing scenarios – idyllic highlands, valleys and woods in the alp-region or the fascinating Toscana region with measured climate.

This game is so obviously bad, so I'm going to review an anime instead. Sola is a good anime. I think it's pretty underrated right now, but I enjoyed it. I liked how they went away from all the romance and made a surprisingly different anime I have seen in my life.
This is most unoptimized, bad looking game I have ever played next to Agricultural Sim. Do not buy. Buy Farming Sim 2013 instead.

I can't figure out how to even play. Other than picking up a log that snaps itsself back to where it was and driving the tractor somewhere, nothing is happening. And the guides aren't much help either.

Disclaimer: I received this game as part of a bundle. $219 for 8 Simulater games.  After watching a Youtube video, it still took me 5 min to figure out how to get the pigs in the stalls. There is a chicken coop, and tons of chickens, but I couldn't figure out how to get the chickens in the coop. I hear cows.... Can't find the cows. After standing next to the tractor for another 5 min. wildly pressing buttons, I finally managed to get on the tractor. Opened store to buy equipment. Game crashed to desktop.  Well, that was a waste of 20min. Even though I only paid 1/8th of $2.19 for this technically.. I still feel ripped off. Graphics are bad.. Controls are bad, The entire interface is needlessly over complicated. Lots of Icons implying that there is stuff you can interact with.. but how? That's the big question.
